citations.narrative:
On January 10th, 2025 an approximately 2 year old cynomolgus macaque had a collar placed following the facility SOP
with no complications. On January 11th, at the morning check, the animal was found deceased in the enclosure with the
collar entangled in the standard perch. Facility personnel immediately worked to free the animal, including removing the
perching. Necropsy showed primarily cardiac abnormalities, but the animal was trapped in the perching and the enclosure
shall not cause injury to the non-human primate housed therein.
On December 17th, 2024, a young rhesus macaque pulled a loop of chain attached to the puzzle ball on the outside of
the enclosure into the enclosure and put his head through. Facility staff noticed the animal in distress, released the chain
and attempted to resuscitate the animal unsuccessfully. While the puzzle ball was located outside the enclosure, the
length of the chain allowed the animal to injure themselves, resulting in their death.
Facility is responsible to ensure that the enclosures are constructed and maintained so that they do not cause injury to the
non-human primates housed within them.
Corrected at the time of inspection on 19 March, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the site director and attending veterinarian.
n

narrative:
3.80(a)(2)(ii)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
On January 10th, 2025 an approximately 2 year old cynomolgus macaque had a collar placed following the facility SOP 
with no complications. On January 11th, at the morning check, the animal was found deceased in the enclosure with the 
collar entangled in the standard perch. Facility personnel immediately worked to free the animal, including removing the 
perching. Necropsy showed primarily cardiac abnormalities, but the animal was trapped in the perching and the enclosure 
shall not cause injury to the non-human primate housed therein. 
 
On December 17th, 2024, a young rhesus macaque pulled a loop of chain attached to the puzzle ball on the outside of 
the enclosure into the enclosure and put his head through. Facility staff noticed the animal in distress, released the chain 
and attempted to resuscitate the animal unsuccessfully. While the puzzle ball was located outside the enclosure, the 
length of the chain allowed the animal to injure themselves, resulting in their death. 
 
Facility is responsible to ensure that the enclosures are constructed and maintained so that they do not cause injury to the 
non-human primates housed within them. 
 
Corrected at the time of inspection on 19 March, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the site director and attending veterinarian.
